Content: https://www.quora.com/What-are-some-really-stealthy-animals

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
```Ninja mouse is a remarkable animal. His light absorbing coat works like a cloak of invisibility, and his whiskers are reputed to be so sensitive that they can detect an owl blink from 50ft away.

But if you visit the Natural History museum in London and ask to see a specimen youâ€™ll be met with blank stares - their collection houses 80 million specimens, and the collection has been digitised so you can search itâ€¦ but you wonâ€™t find a ninja mouse.

Owls have never caught one. So perhaps itâ€™s not surprising that humans havenâ€™t either.

In fact, some question whether ninja mouse even exists, given no one has ever seen or heard one.

Now thatâ€™s stealthy.```

Author: mountaindrifter#4595
Content: So half the coins out there are working hard to be professional and to be accepted by "professionals" . I wonder if this is the best approach. Look how  much adoption DOGE has. Now, I am not suggesting pirate be anything like DOGE,...but my opinion is that if you do what yo ubelive in and enjoy, the adoption will come later. I am also thinking PIRATE will NEVER be accepted by the professionals. It should appeal to those that will actually use it. Ideally a community that enjoys using it rather than professionals that feel it is acceptable....just my 2 cents...well, my two ARRs

Author: Don King#8901
Content: IMO best logo is just the word 'PIRATE' on its own , style to taste, then it can be as professional as any other crypto for those who want/need,  but maintains the 'Arrr' for those who like the vibe of the name. Less is more with logos when the name is cool, and PIRATE is a great name. Personally, the skull and cross bones stuff isn't needed in the logo, add it everywhere else though.
